This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as on rocks or tree trunks in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are usually short and creeping, with a waxy coating that helps retain moisture. Trichomanes adiantoides is often found in epiphytic or lithophytic habitats, thriving in high humidity and indirect light.
